content: the chart every second time you reach the toe with mc you will work short row and end 5 stitches before the end of row wrap&turn and work back the other times you will work all toe sts this will form a tapered toe when working back from the very tip of the toe you will slip the first stitch of the ws row knitwise with yarn in back keep that slipped stitch snug walking in circles by anne-lise maigaard littlegreendragon © 2021 april page 2 work like this provisionally co 164 172 180 188 stitches onto two circular needles* of your chosen size using the figure 8 or winding cast on and mc leave one needle hanging with the provisional stitches on these will rest until you graft the two sides together using the other needle knit 14 16 18 20 stitches place toe marker knit 38 44 50 56 stitches place first heel marker purl 35 stitches place second heel marker knit 77 stitches turn work rs is now facing you ** join cc and start working according to foot and leg chart as described above when done with the foot and leg chart ** knit one row over all stitches using mc then hold sock with right sides facing and close the back seam using russian grafting and a crochet hook*** a size smaller than your needles beginning at the top of the leg insert hook in the first stitch on the cast on side first and ending at the toe make sure you align the pattern row to each other if necessary take 2 stitches together to get the pattern and heel stripes properly aligned cut both yarns secure the last stitch of the bind off then thread the tail end of mc in a circle through all the purl bumps of the slipped stitches of the toe to close it weave in ends work one more sock the same wear with pride * if you do not own a second needle or for some reason do not want to have a second needle dangling while you work the sock you can cast on over a thick piece of scrap yarn or work a provisional crochet cast on consider that you might want to transfer the provisionally cast on stitches back onto a needle before doing the russian grafting in the end ** if you wish to add short row to increase the circumference of the leg relative to the foot this is where you do it work like this using either mc for no stripes or colour 2 for stripes knit ¾ of the leg stitches wrap&turn knit back for even more room using mc knit ½ the leg stitches wrap&turn knit back then continue as
